website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few longevity concerns, this gauge has a nice build with a protective rubber casing and some handy features.
pros: Has a swiveling nozzle and a sturdy, flexible rubber hose for hard-to-reach valves
Rubber casing adds extra protection to the unit
cons: Some reports of inaccurate readings, and of the pointing needle sticking after several weeks or months of use

customer_reviews.title: Not tested or calibrated
customer_reviews.text: I has one with similar build from the other brand and I wanted to try a different brand. I was confused at first because this one reads 3psi lower than my first gauge. Luckily I found the digital Accutire and I confirmed this one is not working properly. 3PSI is more than the acceptable error at 3% or 1.8 PSI. This one was sent back.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Failed after very few uses.
customer_reviews.text: After only about 10 uses on my motorcycle it got stuck at 5psi and now reads very high every time, rendering it unusable. It looked sturdy and semi-pro when I got it and really enjoyed using it, but it let me down suddenly. Any measuring device is only as good as its accuracy and reliability, and this one failed me. I will spend more but will buy something of high quality. Adequate tire pressures are a serious safety requirement (especially in motorcycles, as winter approaches and temps fluctuate / traction is challenged) so buying cheap is irresponsible.
customer_reviews.author: mmb

customer_reviews.title: It's been great for off-roading trips
customer_reviews.text: I tested this analog gauge against another Amazon gauge, (Vepagoo Pro) and a Harbor Freight digital gauge. The TireTek was off by 1lb, where as the Vepagoo was off by 3lbs. I've used this gauge lightly as of purchasing. It's been great for off-roading trips. It helps me release the air from my tires before I hit the trails and makes airing up the the correct pressure easy. Solid quality, easy to read, good value.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Pressure reads 6 lbs high
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product in March 2017. Worked great until Nov 2018 when I used it to check my Rav4 tire pressure before a big road trip and set all tires to 34 lbs. About 60 miles into the trip my car's Tire Pressure Warning System showed low tire pressure in a tire. Pulled into a gas station and all 4 tires were 28 lbs. When I got home I checked this tire gauge with 3 others and this one was showing 6 lbs high. In the garbage it goes now.
customer_reviews.author: D&B H.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars if it held the pressure reading consistently
customer_reviews.text: This is the third flexible hose tire pressure gauge that I've purchased, and hopefully the last for a while. The first two I purchased were from Harbor Freight, and they were pure garbage. With this product, I love the easy-to-read dial; however, I am a little bit disappointed that the gauge will not hold the pressure reading consistently after releasing it from the tire stem. Other than that issue, I would give the Flexi-Pro 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: SAS

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep up on your tire pressure.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use at the race track. The price was right, and so were the reviews. I keep this in my trunk to check my cold PSI every week or so when daily driving. For track: Has nice grip on the body, easy to bleed off pressure with the button, but if you need to bleed off more than 4psi, I would recommend just holding the valve at an angle, its faster than holding the button. Button is better for micro adjusting. I feel comfortable throwing this in a toolbox with other stuff, not afraid of it getting damaged beat up.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: really good, accurate, very high quality gauge
customer_reviews.text: I got so sick of stick style air gauges being all over the place. It seemed like I would never get the same reading twice. This gauge is awesome. It consistent shows the accurate reading time after time. I love that the pressure holds until you press the bleed off button. The bleed off button is also quite handy at reducing pressure very slowly so you can get quite accurate pressures. I wish I would have bought this years ago. All of the awesome reviews aren't for nothing. This gauge is really nice and a great investment in your vehicle and tire's longevity. I am quite sure it will pay for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Lori and Vince

customer_reviews.title: You Decide
customer_reviews.text: I just tested this gauge and compared it with two other gauges that I have at same time and same tire. I run the test 3 times and changed the sequence. Got 3 different readings from these 3 gauges. The largest difference is between TireTek and old fashioned gauge about 3 PSI (35PS vs 32 PSI). Digital gauge was closer to old fashioned showing 32.5 PSI. 3 PSI is more than 8%, 2.5 PSI is about 7.1% comparing TireTek to other two. I am not sure now which one is more accurate
customer_reviews.author: dipling

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: This tire pressure gauge works very good and is accurate when compared with other gauges that I’ve trusted for years. My only small complaint is the business end that you hold against the tire valve could have been slightly larger or had a more “nonslip surface” instead of the nice smooth chrome, because with gloves on, it wasn’t 100% easy to use. But the gauge is well-made and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: SFC USA, Ret

customer_reviews.title: Not At All Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Checked the accuracy of this product against two other DIGITAL pressure gauges that I know are spot on accurate. Results were disappointing. At 24 lbs of pressure, as indicated on the dial, the actual pressure was 33 lbs when measured by gauges of known accuracy. That's a 9 lb. difference in pressure, which can be an enormous difference in terms of obtaining proper or safe tire use. I did not check the gauge at higher pressures, but would expect that the margin of error would increase exponentially as pressures rise. I may have just gotten a defective product, but would not buy it again if accuracy product quality was important.
customer_reviews.author: J B Reisz

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last long
customer_reviews.text: Item stopped working after only a couple uses, now it starts at 7 psi and you have to subtract that to get your actual psi, mad i thought i had bought my last tire pressure gauge too!
customer_reviews.author: bubbles

customer_reviews.title: ***Do not buy***
customer_reviews.text: Failed shortly after buying it. The needle mechanism would move aimlessly. I opened it up and found that the gear mechanism that connects the needle to the air pressure measurement part, became disengaged. Tried to reengage it but the calibration is off. No choice but to throw it away. Bought a longacre gauge to replace it. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Huey Lew

customer_reviews.title: Everything says "high quality"...
customer_reviews.text: Everything is quality on this gauge. For normal passenger car and pickup tires, the 60# range is perfect...more space between graduations, so is easier to read. Upon receipt, I cross-checked the accuracy with a professional grade pencil-type gauge, and a high quality digital (Accutire). All three showed exactly the same pressure readings. I like the "bleed-off" valve...my normal practice is to slightly overinflate, then bleed pressure down to the desired figure. This makes that very easy to accomplish. Gauge appears durable, and is well-protected against setting down too hard, or small distance drops, by the "tire" cushioning the dial. If it holds up, as it looks like it should, I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Don From Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Kinda difficult angle of attachment point
customer_reviews.text: Tough to use in tight places. I must be EXACTLY in one spot to check pressure on my sport bike tires, brake discs and wheel/tire width interfere. But then again, i have some difficulty with ANY gauge on that bike. Fine if no obstructions present. Didn't double check for accuracy, but whats a pound or two among friends?
customer_reviews.author: Robbo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to read, adequately accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these to try. I was quite satisfied with the operation and accuracy. I gave it to my daughter for her car and promptly bought two more for my truck and car. Much more convenient and more reliable long term than the electronic gauges. Accuracy compared well with on board gauges on my cars. I would recommend this gauge over most of the others I have used over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Canyon Mike

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product and a great Value.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I have a car that sometimes will tell me that my air pressure is low, but the dashboard doesn't say which tire is low! So I then have to go through the motions of filling each tire with air just to see which one is low. (Since I cant tell by looking). My experience with the cheaper gauges that have the little ruler pop out just are not accurate and tend to give a different reading each time. This TireTek Flexi-Pro is so easy to read, and I love how it stays on the reading until you click the release button. High recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V

customer_reviews.title: Key Feature failed quickly
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product, for a short while. One of the best features is that it holds the pressure until the button is pressed. This allows you to take a reading and then remove from the tire and move to better light to see the result. My gauge no longer holds the pressure like this. Overwise it seems like a good product. Update: I contacted the seller, and they immediately shipped out a replacement. Hassle free and no need to return original. This is great customer service. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT retain Pressure Reading when Removed from the Tire Valve - FAULTY
customer_reviews.text: The TireTek Flexi-Pro Tire Pressure Gauge should retain the pressure reading when removed from the tire valve until the pressure release / bleed button is pressed on the side of the gauge stem. I had to return 2 of them as this did not work as both had the same fault. The competitor product Accu-Gage RRA60X was delivered yesterday and performs as expected. I would recommend this product instead as they are similarly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. J. Upton

customer_reviews.title: A great tire pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a decent tire pressure gauge. When I found this one, I knew that I’d like it and I do! The hose is nice in that it swivels at both ends so it’s easy to get it on the valve stem. And with the way it holds the pressure reading in til your release it, is super convenient. You can bend over and get the reading and then stand up while you read it. It’s works very well and I can’t wait for some of my classic car buddies to see it next time we’re all together.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS ONE. YOU WON'T REGRET IT!
customer_reviews.text: The TireTek Flexi-Pro Tire Pressure Gauge is a great piece of high-quality gear that has made my travels soooo much easier, and safer, too. For decades, I've used a plain aluminum tube-type air checker. I was a bit skittish about the price of the TireTek initially, but upon receiving it, it became obvious that you do get what you pay for! I drive an SUV, a 50cc scooter, and also ride a bicycle. This tire gauge is great for all three! If you want the best tire gauge you'll ever own, take my advice: BUY THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Lemmy Lugosi

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good packaging; and most importantly...
customer_reviews.text: arrived in record time; good packaging; and most importantly, resolved a TPS issue we have had with my daughters car for months. Used a "cheap 12V compressor with an even cheaper gauge", realized that despite the readings on the compressor gauge the tire pressure was 5-6psi too low when using this Tire Tek Flexi-pro gauge; pumped up tires using the release feature of this new gauge to same pressure all around; reset TPS; no more light! yes, it was a bit expensive, but it will from now on settle any discrepancies on our cars' tire pressure
customer_reviews.author: DaMeister

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 of these extremely "accurate" gauges, and after ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these extremely "accurate" gauges, and after airing up several cars, I checked the pressure between these 2 extremely "accurate gauges, and found them 5 lbs off of each other........
customer_reviews.author: douglas delano

customer_reviews.title: Likely impossible to beat, especially for motorcyclists!
customer_reviews.text: This gauge is EXACTLY what I have been searching for with the two easily-switched chucks. Being a motorcyclist with bikes with huge brake rotors up front and out back plus a drive chain on the other side of the rear, this gauge is perfection for me! It sticks to the valve like it is part of it while I bleed pressure off where many just slip off the valve probably due to poor design. Of course, I can't speak to the life cycle yet since I just got it but everything else is outstanding and it certainly LOOKS and FEELS like it will last forever. A truly GREAT product! Thanks for making it available at such a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: you

customer_reviews.title: No Dead Batteries to worry about when using this gauge.
customer_reviews.text: I received the gauge today and have not used it yet. I wanted a tire pressure guage to keep in my car so that I could check the pressure if the warning light came on in my car. I have found that while air is available at many service stations, accurate pressure gauges are not. I purchased this for peace of mind when driving in remote areas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never have a doubt about your tires having the right amount of air
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever seen before any race , guys checking all the tires. They weren't using pencil air gauges. They were using a quality gauge because it mattered. Tires cost a lot and can keep you safe when needed most. But it sure helps to have the correct air pressure . I care enough to want my tires properly inflated. And I trust this Gauge. It looks and feels very well made. The fit and Finnish is on par with any other top flight air gauge. I will never go back to a pencil air gauge or some mucky mouse brand air gauge. Get a Flexi Pro and you will understandably
customer_reviews.author: J. STERLING

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for an accurate tire gauge - and this is it!
customer_reviews.text: Great vendor; quality gauge. Not sure about the orientation of the dial. I think I'd prefer one with the face turned 180 degrees. There are 2 schools of thought on that; neither is right or wrong. I especially like the fact that you can bleed air out of a tire by pressing the reading release button. That enables you to overinflate a tire, then bleed air until you reach the exact desired pressure. The range of the pressure scale is perfect for the average vehicle. Instead of a gauge going from 0 to 250 psi with graduations scrunched so tightly together as to be inexact, this gauge has like 1/8" spaces between
customer_reviews.author: Tonasco - Phoenix, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gauge a couple of weeks ago to replace a similar one that had stopped working after 30-some years. I was glad to find a new one with the 45-degree angle on the valve end to make it easy to press onto a variety of Stoddard valve positions, and the pressure-release valve on the gauge end to easily let a controlled amount of air out of an over-inflated tire. The easily-flexible hose makes this gauge easier to handle than my old one ever was. I don't yet know about reliability, of course; right now, I'm glad to have a product with these features readily available.
customer_reviews.author: mgoodyear

customer_reviews.title: Very Accurate
customer_reviews.text: The gauge on my air tank indicated 35 psi and a slide gauge indicated the same psi when airing my trucks tires. However my trucks computer told me the tires only had 31 psi. I set out on a journey to get an accurate gauge and found this one. When first used it indicated 31 psi same as my trucks indicator. The little air release button is very nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Z

customer_reviews.title: Did not last !! But, great seller.
customer_reviews.text: I am revising my review because the seller contacted me and offered a refund or replacement in a very courteous and professional manner = so although I had a problem with the tire gauge, the seller resolved it in a highly satisfactory manner. ........ I was really pleased with this tire pressure gauge for a few months. I check the pressure weekly on 4 vehicles. I was right in the middle of testing this week and the tire pressure gauge failed - it developed a leak where the flex tube is attached to gauge. the gauge has never been abused or misused in any way so it must just be a lack of manufacturing quality.
customer_reviews.author: maximin

customer_reviews.title: great tire gauge
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these for gifts. They work well and are so easy to use and to read that I bought one for myself as well. My daughter is able to check the air in her tires with ease and it brings her peace of mind when traveling to and from college. The end is curved so that you an easily reach hard to reach stems. It will hold the reading until you push a button to clear it so that you will know the exact pressure even after removing it from the valve stem. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gauge.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tire gauge. It is now my go to gauge that I trust. It reads accurately and I like that it holds the pressure reading until you release it. This makes it easy to apply to a valve stem, remove the gauge, and hold it at a better position to view the reading. I did have a faulty gauge delivered to me, but the company sent me a new one after verifying with a local tire shop the gauge wasn't reading correctly. The company stood behind their product and sent me a new one immediately. I have recommend led this gauge to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF K

customer_reviews.title: Best I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Fir 40 years I have been checking my tires regularly, and have used gauges of all types., sticks, round, and electronic. This one works so well, i bought another to leave in my second luxury car. The display is easy to read. If you put in a little too much air, just press the button where you hold it and ket out a little bit at a time. As close to perfect as I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy PH

customer_reviews.title: Accurate/Quality tire pressure gauge.
customer_reviews.text: This is used primarily for autox, I need to accurately take 1psi of air out of my tires after a series of laps as they heat up. I compared this gauge to several different digital/analog gones used by competitors and found it to be accurate between 30-40psi as I need it to be (within 1psi). The hose/fittings/gauge all seem to be sturdy enough to hold up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Straubinger

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this gauge after looking at all the excellent reviews and checked
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new 2015 Ford Focus ST in June and damn low tire pressure light came on. Rating is 36 lbs for the tires and some cheap stick gauge I had laying around could not be read. Said all tires were proper. Ordered this gauge after looking at all the excellent reviews and checked , 3 of the tires were indeed 36 but one was 30....and that’s what set off the sensor. Filled it to proper spec and that built in pressure release button is awesome ...overfilled by 2 pounds, adjusted it with this tool and eureka..light went off immediately:) Very accurate. A mechanic friend threatened to steal it. Ha. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: JustBrutal

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an accurate and well made gauge. I have had several analog gauges that were not accurate. Based on reviews, I bought this one and am very pleased. I find it to be very accurate, easy to read, and it appears to be very durable. It was also a very good value at a little over $15.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly good.. I was surprised with the quality
customer_reviews.text: this is a pretty good buy, the head rotates so you can look at the dial regardless of how you take the read, it also holds the pressure so you take a measurement and the needle does not move down to zero after you take it of the valve. then there's a push button to release the pressure or use as to deflate (if you over inflated)
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on cheap, inaccurate gauges for something so important. Your life depends upon it.
customer_reviews.text: This is an accurate and well-made tire pressure gauge. Recently, after being lazy and not checking the air in my motorcycle tires for several weeks (bad move), I went to a service station and had a mechanic check the pressure. He said the front was over-inflated, and the front just under, which seemed odd after nearly 2 months without checking. I received this gauge and was in fact under 4 lbs in each tire. I then used my Dynaplug micro-inflator to pump up the tire in a matter of seconds. Both great purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: cheap and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for my son. the item worked 3 or 4 times and then would not give a accurate reading. it would go to 45psi when pushed on and then when removed would read a much lower PSI and lock at that number. there are other units to buy, don't get this one.
customer_reviews.author: james riseborough

customer_reviews.title: The reviews indicated a quality item, however, I ...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews indicated a quality item, however, I got to use this once on my motorcycle tires, it worked well. At some point though, it fell or something and the dial inside became detached, and the needle no longer moved. I expected more quality from such a highly rated product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Impulse buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this very last minute for a track day at ButtonWillow. Turned out to be spot-on accurate (within 1psi) and it was very easy to check pressures between sessions. Swivels are great for a fast pressure read. Push to bleed feature was a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Pooft Lee

customer_reviews.title: The swivels on both ends of the hose make it extremely easy to use in any position of the tire stem ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made tire pressure gauge. The swivels on both ends of the hose make it extremely easy to use in any position of the tire stem valve. It closely tracks the measurements I made with a much more expensive gauge that I have, so I believe that it is pretty accurate. You get what you pay for---this gauge costs more than some others, but it is worth it. It is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun Boy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gauge for motorcyclists.
customer_reviews.text: Valves on many motorcycle rims (like my FJR1300 Yamaha) with disc brakes can be very hard to reach and get a good seal on with other tire gauges. Some folks resort to installing 90 degree valves to solve the problem. You need not do that if you have this gauge. With regular straight valves, it's easy to check inflation. The swiveling head is made to get into those hard-to-reach spots and provide the very positive seal needed for a good, accurate reading. This gauge also holds the last reading until you hit the bleed button. The dial is quite easy to read too.
customer_reviews.author: Linebacker--58

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gauge.
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for an accurate and easy to read gauge and found it with the TireTek Flexi-Pro. The rubber case surrounding the gauge makes the gauge easy to grip and provides excellent protection if dropped. The one feature I really like is the pressure release valve. Not only does it hold the pressure reading when you remove the gauge from the tire but you can also use it to let air out of the tire in very fine increments to set it exactly where you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Unwound

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gauge.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gauge. I like the button to hold the reading after you remove the gauge from the tire. I never trusted myself to use the old fashioned tire gauge with the sliding piece of plastic for the PSI and get a good reading. I like this way better.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesguy

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Tire Gauge
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice analog gauge. I've used it several times now and I'm pleased with the purchase. It look and feels well made. The hose is helpful in allowing you to see the gauge while you are measuring the tire pressure. The pressure relief valve, a feature which many digital gauges do not have, is quite useful in dialing in the exact pressure desired. The rubber housing around the housing is a helpful design feature protecting the gauge. Since it has the hose, it is fairly large, so it might not be as well suited to a small glove compartment, but it is a great addition to my garage toolbox. I prefer it over the digital types.
customer_reviews.author: SheppardVelo

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Tire Gauge!
customer_reviews.text: With TPMS in my Toyota, I am alerted when it senses low tire pressure, but NOT to which tire! (My VW was able to identify the tire). This requires one to have a Tire Pressure guage on hand. I went threw a slew of them.....Electronic is nice, but the batteries don't last and it could be dead when you finally need it. The old cheap pen gauges are flimsy and are not always accurate. Now THIS gauge is built STRONG. I like the flexible hose and the gauge with the aire release mechanism. I tried it multiple times and always receibed the same reading. Hopefully it is built to last longer than my car :)
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, love the short flexible hose, and that it will maintain pressure reading once removed from the stem. Having a pressure release button is very handy also. Only thing I thought was weird is you have to release the pressure between uses or it will not give an accurate reading when increasing pressure. At least mine didn't. Yes, it's a bit more expensive than some, but the quality is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A company that stands behind its product!!
customer_reviews.text: Tire gauge failed after checking 4 tires - would not hold reading after removing from tire. emailed Tire-Tek and asked for ways to fix. Got email back from Frank (company founder) the next morning with 2 possible fixes. emailed him back later that day - no luck. email from Frank same day - sending new gauge (with apology for inconvenience) - keep the old one. New gauge works like a charm. A pleasure to deal with a small company that stands behind its product!!
customer_reviews.author: hopewell guy

customer_reviews.title: I love my new Tire Tex Flexi-Pro Tire Pressure Gauge
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Tire Tex Flexi-Pro Tire Pressure Gauge ! When I went looking for an air gauge the other day I found about 8 to 10 that either weren't working or every one that was working had a different reading than the other one. Now I have an accurate one that I can let some air out and continually read instead of having to disconnect and reconnect. Easy to read and hold on to and with the 90 degree accessory tip I'll be able to fill my cycle tires with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Shroyer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these and a JACO at the same time. Both are really good products and worth the money, though I personally prefer the JACO, it just seems to have a little nicer heft to it. In truth, either one is absolutely a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Soots

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality, sturdy, A+ tire pressure gauge. Great vendor and customer service. I purchased this because I always had to put my reading glasses on to use the old fashioned, gas station type gauges. This one is easy to read and very accurate. Keep it in my car at all times to make the process much easier than before I had this. Nice compact size but not too short to comfortably check your tire pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: product is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product came in 2 days (awesome) it is easy to use and easy to read also I checked the pressure against 3 other PSI gauges and was spot on. Great product I would definitely suggest this to my friends. P S. The ribbed outer surface makes it very easy to hold and use. Nick Riccardi
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: Good gauge witha couple of qualifications.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a very accurate gauge. It is convenient when it holds the pressure reading until it is released. Would have given it five stars but the valve that makes contact with the tire stem is so slippery that it is very difficult to hold in the right position on the valve stem. The hose is also too stiff in my opinion and could be a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gauge!
customer_reviews.text: The gauge was as described and seems to work very well. The pressure measured actually "holds" in position so I can take a reading down by the tire and then bring the gauge back up to where I can more easily read it. There's a button you press to "reset" back to zero. I love it. Great product and very fast shipping and good service.
customer_reviews.author: zander

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart. Defective rubber ring.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Fell apart the first time used. It looks good. It feels good. I agree with those reviews who think the dial orientation should have been reversed. I like the gauge holding the pressure reading.
customer_reviews.author: G. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Did not read accurately as it would give me the reading of 33 PSI of my tires which I found out later they were losing air from the 30-PSI recommended pressure. I had to return it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rony

customer_reviews.title: works great. accurate. easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is very accurate and easy to use. Much easier and far more accurate than the pen style gague. Easy to store in glove box.
customer_reviews.author: DMR

customer_reviews.title: A good gauge at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Gauge seems to be well made with durable materials.. I like the flex hose as my previous gauge only had a 1-1/2" rigid tube which would not reach the valves on a couple of pieces of equipment I have. I can use this gauge on all the equipment I have very easily. Company is also very interested in customer satisfaction which is even more important.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bedenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my motorcycles.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for motorcycle tires. The flexible hose gets in and around the disk brake on the front and the chain/exhaust on the rear wheel for both the Yamaha FZ01 and the Suzuki Hayabusa. The button for letting out excess pressure comes in very handy when overfilling the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Software Designer

customer_reviews.title: The pressure gauge came broken and is very hard to use because of that.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the pressure gauge. It came broken and the tip gets loose every time I try to use it. In my case, it was money lost.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Quinones

customer_reviews.title: The TireTek Flexi-Pro Tire Pressure Gauge is great! The angled valve is much easier and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The TireTek Flexi-Pro Tire Pressure Gauge is great! The angled valve is much easier and the dual rotating connections ensure that I can actually see the gauge no matter where the tire stem is. The dial is large enough to see the smaller interim hash marks and hose is long enough to comfortable view the gauge while still on the tire valve. The pressure release works very well allowing quick fine tuning of the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Horse Lover

customer_reviews.title: I don't think you'll find a better tire pressure gauge than this
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you'll find a better tire pressure gauge than this. It's extremely well built, sturdy and very practical. Both the reading gauge and the adapter that fit to the tire stem swivel so you never have to contort yourself to read your tire pressure. The gauge itself is well marked and easy to read. The short flexible hose even adds to the ease of use. There are many lesser quality mass produced gauges to choose from, but this is a well designed gauge from a small business that really cares about their product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Compton

customer_reviews.title: Fairly decent pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: Seems fairly accurate. Stiff hose makes it somewhat awkward to use. I like the pressure relief button as it makes it easy to bleed air from a slightly overinflated tire. So so quality materials wise.
customer_reviews.author: Bookstore Willie

customer_reviews.title: This gauge was very accurate as compared to two other ...
customer_reviews.text: This gauge was very accurate as compared to two other brands of known accuracy. It was accurate to less than 1 psi. It is now just under 1 year old and it will no longer hold the pressure reading after it is disconnected from the tire -- it immediately falls back to zero upon disconnect. I purchased two of these (the second did not have the extension hose) and the second one is just as accurate and still holds the measured pressure after it is disconnected from the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Gauge!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After realizing that I couldn't trust the accuracy of a digital gauge I had received as a gift a few years ago, I began looking for a quality tire gauge, and decided on the TireTek. I am very pleased!!! It is easy to use, easy to read, and the chuck fits quickly on the valve stem without all that hissing loss of air that I used to hear. I highly recommend the TireTek Flex-Pro Tire Pressure Gauge!!
customer_reviews.author: BlueRidgeBob

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a nice guage.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built and accurate. Slightly harder to get a seal on the valve stem than with the Moroso that it replaced, but as the reading locks with only a momentary connection, it works just as well. And it appears to be durable enough to survive longer than the previous one I had did. Of course, the moroso with a ruber wrapper on it would have also survived, but this one was half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Guage
customer_reviews.text: Tire gauge was shipped very quickly, and I didn't have a chance to use for a couple weeks. Once I had an opportunity, I believe it worked flawlessly, was very easy to handle and read, and was very accurate! Very pleased! I also own a motorcycle, and this gauge will be perfect for setting the tire pressure on my motorcycle exactly where I want it, which is critical to proper handling and safety. Great gauge, great price, a very happy customer!! AAAAA
customer_reviews.author: Old Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool, but not a great fit for HD motorcycles with disk brakes
customer_reviews.text: Nice pressure guage. Large white easy to read dial. My only complaint would be the 45 degree end. It is very difficult to use with Harley-Davidson motorcycles with disk brakes. Difficult to get straight on the valve stem. I would prefer a 90 degree end. My old pressure guage had the 90 degree end which was easier to get onto the valve stem, helping to maintain the internal tire pressure. I think for most purposes you would love this pressure guage.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: It's The One To Get!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years we have bought those stick type tire pressure gauges. But we never felt we were getting an accurate reading. I love this tire pressure gauge! It is a bit bigger than the stick type and not as easy to store...but it works so much better and is easy to read. It is comfortable to hold and use and you can easily get an accurate reading. It's great that it holds the reading for you until you hit the button. Definitely recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Pass

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Nice soft rubber, feels like it should handle falls with no problem. Connector engages well without leaking or needing much pressure. The hose freely rotates which is nice for aligning the gauge and chuck separately. Seems quite accurate and matches my other gauges. Very pleased with the purchase. My only complaint is that I wish there was a presta version. Beware I tried a similar unit that looked very similar (not TireTek), but wasn't nearly as nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Broadley

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: After I get fed up with the cheap pen-type tire gauges, I finally broke down and paid for a good one. I got this one based on the reviews, and it stacks up. It's a solid construction, it feels substantial when you use it. It's not only accurate but the large dial allows you to read it very accurately. Definitely better than anything they had at the two auto parts chain stores here. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A. Fishwild

customer_reviews.title: I bought the Flexi-Pro to address these issues and I have been very pleased. The Flexi-Pro is very accurate and readings are ...
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of typical pencil or gauge only pressure gauges for my tires especially since their accuracy and repeatability was always questionable. I bought the Flexi-Pro to address these issues and I have been very pleased. The Flexi-Pro is very accurate and readings are very repeatable. The addition of the short hose makes the gauge very easy to use. Best tire pressure gauge I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Thornock

customer_reviews.title: Accurate pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: I love the flexibility of this pressure gauge. Very easy to use and holds the pressure until you release it. Makes it very easy to read. Seems to be very well made. I expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: INACURRATE AUTO TIRE AIR PRESSURE READINGS
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT SHOW ACCURATE-CORRECT AIR PRESSURE READINGS! USED 3 OTHER AIR GAUGES THAT RECORDED THE SAME HIGHER AIR PRESSURES THAN THIS DEVICE WHICH WAS 3-5 DEGREES LOWER.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice gauge.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. A little hard to use on my motorcycle wheels with the angle though.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Design!
customer_reviews.text: Was thrilled when I found this product. We have a gauge at the top of our new hot water heater where we have to check the pressure every 6 months with a tire gauge. Using a standard gauge was difficult but this new design made it so easy! Works great on our cars too!! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: janetb

customer_reviews.title: This device fits fine and I especially like the ability to bleed air ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because none of the other tire gauges we own (three of them) would fit between the valve stem and the rear axle of our 2006 Kawasaki Ninja. This device fits fine and I especially like the ability to bleed air from the tire with the gauge. My only complaint about the device is I wish the stem turned 90 degrees instead of 45 degrees but that is a minor thing and only matters when reading the motorcycle tire.
customer_reviews.author: retired mom

customer_reviews.title: Large Dial Sturdy Construction
customer_reviews.text: The pressure gauge will be my go to tire gauge. I've used different pen type gauges in the past and was torn between a digital gauge or the TireTek Flexi-Pro. I decided on the TireTek and am extremely happy with this purchase. It's accurate, easy to read, and easy to use. The sturdy construction will most likely mean you won't ever have to use the Lifetime Warranty that they offer when you register your product.
customer_reviews.author: Sui Duc

customer_reviews.title: ... product has a large 2 inch dial which is great for older eyes
customer_reviews.text: This product has a large 2 inch dial which is great for older eyes. It is very easy to see and read the one pound increments. The hold feature is very good too. The needle stays at the reading until manually released. This allows for a good look to make sure of the reading. And the rubber surrounding the dial should help prevent damage if dropped or struck.. I like this product and I would recommend it. And the readings are consistent. Many pencil gauges will give varying readings.
customer_reviews.author: Tex1911

customer_reviews.title: Love the heft to it
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product! Love the heft to it...it doesn't feel cheap and flimsy. Made solidly, protected with a rubber cover, easy to check and use. Also like the flexible rubber hose...makes it real easy to check my bike, motorcycle, car, any vehicle. And the "memory" feature lets you check the air and still see the reading after you have removed the head. Did I mention you can easily let air out of the tire without disconnecting? Lots of great features and well worth the affordable price. I tossed all my cheap pen type gauges and plan to use only this one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Warner

customer_reviews.title: Appears to work well,
customer_reviews.text: Better then pencil type pres-gauges; readings are reproducable; easy to read & reset. Cannot determine accuracy with out the use of a standarized gauge as a test control.
customer_reviews.author: J.Mor

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate air pressure gage. The gas station air pumps suck at best and are horrible inaccurate. Now I over inflate my tires and use this gauge with it’s easy to use bleeder button to keep my tire pressure perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. I use it just a few times a year, but seems like a well-constructed product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I have this device for over two years and I am sorry to report that it doesn't last. The quality is not good enough for it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Given that I just got it and have used it only once, looks like "two thumbs up". Though the scale goes only to 60 lbs, the gauge indicates a bit beyond that.... which is good for airing-up your spare tire limper @ 60. Positive that the gauge "holds" reading until you push the release button and the release button can be used to bleed off excess pressure. Works well and just like it should! RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Hose

customer_reviews.title: HURRAY, I'M A ROAD WARRIOR!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a middle-aged gal who drives the rough-and-tumble roads of Detroit, Michigan... The TireTek Flexi-Pro helps me take on the abysmal potholes that bully my tires every day. If ONLY the head on the gas station pump were as user-friendly and innovative as this gadget--which makes a tedious job pretty much bearable. Buy one for each and every one of your significant others!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna D.

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY A Practical Tire Gauge!
customer_reviews.text: Having a large dial with white background and graduations that are easy to read is SO important and saves time. I used to squint trying to read my old gauge that went up to 100 psi making hard to read 32 psi on a black background. The black tire portion is durable and comfortable to grip and there is a bleeder button that makes it easy to let out unwanted air. It also shows the pressure after you remove the gauge from the tire.
customer_reviews.author: ISLNDR

customer_reviews.title: robust and easy to use tire pressure gauge for years (decades actually)
customer_reviews.text: I have been after an accurate, robust and easy to use tire pressure gauge for years (decades actually). Yours finally makes the grade, immediately threw out any other gauge I had. Great touches like the swiveling head, properly engineered valve connector that doesn't loose air pressure trying to connect with the valve stem and the bleed off switch that allows precise setting of pressure. Brilliant product, well done
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Willett

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gauge, As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent gauge. It is well built, lightweight and seems to be as accurate as advertised. I use this gauge on my Harley Davidson Ultra. It would work even better for Harley's if it had a 90 degree right angle nozzle because Harley's have those big brake rotors that make it hard to get around with a gauge. If they come out with one like that, I will buy it. I recommend this gauge to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The day after the gauge arrived I received an email from the Co-Founder of OdyseaCo, Frank Jackson, asking me if I received the product and to let him know if there was anything wrong with the product so he can take care of it. It shows he cares about customer satisfaction. The gauge is good quality. The head turns so it can be adjusted to line up with the tire stem.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Works properly and easy to read and use.
customer_reviews.text: I only had one of those little pen gauges which I could not use and never showed the same number twice. My car was showing the low tire alert on my dash even though I used my husband's compressor with gauge to top off my tires. After I got this gauge, I got an accurate reading and was able to top off my tires to the proper pressure and my warning light went out. Easy to use. Easy to read gauge. I feel I can rely on this gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen K.

customer_reviews.title: ... product without problems and it seems to work just fine. I used it the day I got it ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the product without problems and it seems to work just fine. I used it the day I got it to check the tire pressures on my family cars and as far as I can tell it’s pretty accurate. I especially like the flexibility of the connecting hose and the large readout which helps my old eyes. Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Grimsteed

customer_reviews.title: ... Tire Tek Flex Pro tire pressure gauge is the best tire pressure gauge I've ever owned in my many ...
customer_reviews.text: The Tire Tek Flex Pro tire pressure gauge is the best tire pressure gauge I've ever owned in my many years of working on my cars (I'm 82 years old). An added feature of the gauge is that when you remove the gauge from the tire it retains the pressure reading until you release the air in the hose. This would be a help for someone who hadn't observed the reading on the gauge when they removed it from the valve stem.
customer_reviews.author: PBX Bob

customer_reviews.title: Best Tire Gauge Around
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he says it is the best tire gauge he has ever used. Very easy to release air if you over-inflate your tire. Extremely easy to read the gauge with the longer flex hose. Got tired of buying cheaper pressure gauges that didn't provide an accurate reading. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Works well, well made.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, I like that the reading remains trapped until the pressure is released and that the gage is mounted upside down for easy reading.
customer_reviews.author: Manfish

customer_reviews.title: Good gauge at good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good gauge, good price. I bought it as a backup to my digital (battery powered) gauge. I found that my digital gauge was more accurate that I thought ( I thought it read low). This gauge reads 0.5 psi lower than my digital at 30 psi. That makes my compressor gauge high (or these two low) 😱. Anyway happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: mach1

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Unit- Glad I found this!!! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME!! Quality product, accurate, easy to use. It seems to me as though a quality tire pressure gauge used to be pretty easy to find. However, I've gone through at least four cheap ones that each cost around $10-12 from local auto chains in the past decade. This bad boy is exactly the ticket I was looking for, and comes with a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: J Dingo

customer_reviews.title: Well made easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used it once and the quality was obvious. It works as it should and better. I did not think an air gauge needed to be anything special, but it can and this unit is. Placing on the valve makes a closed seal. No adjustments needed. The readout on the gauge is precise. It stays at the reading until you push the reset or relief valve. I was able to reduce tire pressure on my motorcycle easily and accurately. It is a joy to use a well made tool.
customer_reviews.author: Santo

customer_reviews.title: Great for the glove box!
customer_reviews.text: This gauge is rock solid and very accurate. Checked accuracy after an accidental drop against several other gauges and it continues to remain accurate. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Put it in my motorcycle kit. T-CLOCS starts with the tires.
customer_reviews.author: FriscoRN

product_meta.title: TireTek Motorcycle Tire Pressure Gauge 0-60 PSI - Tire Gauge with Flexible Air Chuck and ANSI B40.1 Accuracy for Motorcycle, Bike, ATV, Car and SUV
product_meta.description:
Why buy the TireTek Flexi-Pro Professional Tire Pressure Gauge?

MEASUREMENT RANGE OF 0-60 PSI - perfect for reading tire pressure for any car, truck, suv, bicycle or motorcycle

LARGE & EASY-TO-READ 2 INCH HIGH-CONTRAST DIAL - clearer, more accurate display

360 DEGREE SWIVEL CHUCK - so the dial can be read easily at any angle or position

REINFORCED RUBBER HOSE - no air leakage, accurate readings, heavy duty air pressure gauge and built to last

FREE PROTECTIVE CARRYING CASE - helps you stay organized and protects your tire gauge from drops and knocks

INTEGRATED BLEED VALVE - this easy button allows for precise tire pressure adjustments for overinflated tires

RELIABLE MECHANICAL GAUGE - dependable and accurate pressure readings for years without any batteries!

 


Why TireTek?

TireTek is a quality automotive accessories brand specializing in calibrated mechanical tire pressure gauges and inflators 100% certified to ANSI B40.1 accuracy standards. We are the trusted choice for any passenger vehicle, car, truck, bicycle or motorcycle.


Benefits of using the TireTek Flexi-Pro Car Tire Pressure Gauge:

SAVE MONEY ON TIRES - preventing over/under inflation dramatically reduces tire wear extending the life of your tires

SAVE MONEY ON FUEL - maintaining your tires at the correct air pressure can save you money at the gas pump

BETTER HANDLING - regular tire pressure monitoring is not only easy but ensures optimum vehicle performance especially in the case of an emergency

KEEP YOUR FAMILY SAFE - low pressure / under inflated tires are the most common cause of tire failure. Proper tire inflation means all occupants are safer in your vehicle.


Buy your Tire Pressure Gauge today with confidence knowing your tire gauge comes with a LIFETIME PRODUCT WARRANTY (yes really!)


Sold exclusively by OdyseaCo
feature_bullets: RECOMMENDED BY MECHANICS - Steel in construction with an extended 5mm chuck tip so you get a great seal with no air leakage. This automotive tool is robust, durable, is surrounded by a rubber cover so it is protected from drops and has a reinforced rubber hose. Superior in quality, it will not let you down.

EASY TO USE - With a 360 degree angled rotating nozzle, enabling you to take a reading from a tire valve at any angle. The large easy to read scale and pressure holding function that keeps the reading on the gauge even after it has been taken off the valve, makes it perfect for any car, suv, rv, atv, truck, bike or motorcycle.
NO BATTERIES REQUIRED - This top rated, reliable, professional tire monitoring system is easy to use and will work in all weather conditions. An ideal automotive accessory.

MAKE SURE YOU HAVE CORRECT TIRE PRESSURES This mechanical tire gauge is calibrated to ANSI B40.1 Grade B (2%) international accuracy standard to ensure you get an accurate reading. In addition it features an integrated bleed button for precise tire pressure adjustment of over inflated tires.

SAVE MONEY ON FUEL And keep your family safe. An excellent gift for men or women, ideal for birthdays or Christmas. The best auto device buy in confidence today and get our 100% lifetime satisfaction guarantee.
